results:
Based on the search results, I can provide information about "Alicja w Krainie Czarów" (Alice in Wonderland) in the context of the Polish education system:

## Alicja w Krainie Czarów in Polish Education

Alicja w Krainie Czarów by Lewis Carroll is available as "lektury szkolne z omówieniem" (school reading with commentary), indicating its use in Polish educational curricula.

### Educational Use

A 5th grade class (klasa 5a) created board games inspired by the content of this required reading, showing how the book is actively used in Polish elementary schools. The work is taught through structured lesson cycles in 5th grade of primary school (klasa V SP), with lessons covering the author, the work itself, and the presented world.

### Curriculum Integration

The book appears to be part of Polish literature curriculum with comprehensive educational support:

- Carroll's works, including Alice in Wonderland, became fundamental foreign literature for children, suitable for children up to 6 years old entering the world of literature and youth seeking inspiration in Polish and foreign literature

- Lesson plans include "Mądrości z Krainy Czarów" (Wisdom from Wonderland), focusing on extracting moral and educational content

### Publishing and Accessibility

Alice in Wonderland in the "Kolorowa Klasyka" (Colorful Classics) series is described as "the most beautiful colorful edition of this novel on the market", making it accessible and appealing to Polish students. The first Polish translation appeared in 1910, forty-five years after the English original was published.

The work is clearly established as part of Polish educational reading lists, with structured lesson plans and educational materials designed specifically for Polish students at the elementary level.
